heroSafety.title: Is NYC Safe at Night for Solo Travelers?
heroSafety.subtitle: NYC is generally safe at night in busy, well-lit areas—if you follow smart, local-backed precautions.

safetyMeter.quickSummary: NYC’s busiest areas remain active and well-patrolled at night. Risks increase in quieter neighborhoods and during late-night transit.

corePrinciples.title: Read the Room
corePrinciples.description: Scan the environment every few minutes to understand the vibe, foot traffic, and exits.
corePrinciples.example: If a block suddenly gets quiet or lighting drops, switch to a busier avenue.

corePrinciples.title: Plan Your Moves
corePrinciples.description: Know your next 2–3 steps before you start walking — route, transit option, and backup.
corePrinciples.example: If the subway platform looks empty, pivot to a bus or rideshare instead of waiting alone.

corePrinciples.title: Stay in the Flow
corePrinciples.description: Stick to well‑lit, high‑foot‑traffic streets and avoid sudden detours into quiet blocks.
corePrinciples.example: Walk along 7th Ave instead of cutting through an empty side street after 11 PM.

corePrinciples.title: Signal Confidence
corePrinciples.description: Walk with purpose, keep your head up, and avoid behaviors that signal distraction.
corePrinciples.example: Hold your phone at chest level for navigation instead of staring down at it.

corePrinciples.title: Trust Micro‑Signals
corePrinciples.description: If something feels off — a person, a block, a station — change direction immediately.
corePrinciples.example: If someone starts pacing near you on the platform, move closer to the conductor.

faq.question: Is NYC safe for solo female travelers at night?
faq.answer: Yes, especially in busy areas like Midtown, SoHo, and the Upper West Side.

faq.question: Which NYC neighborhoods are safest to walk in at night?
faq.answer: Midtown, SoHo, Greenwich Village, and Brooklyn Heights stay active and well-lit into the night.

faq.question: Is the NYC subway safe at night?
faq.answer: Yes on busy lines, but avoid empty cars and transfer stations late at night.

faq.question: Is it safe to walk alone in NYC after 10 PM?
faq.answer: Stick to main avenues, avoid isolated parks, and stay in well-lit, busy areas.

faq.question: Are NYC tourist spots safe at night?
faq.answer: Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and DUMBO remain busy and safe for solo travelers.

faq.question: What should solo travelers avoid at night in NYC?
faq.answer: Avoid empty subway cars, isolated parks, and quiet industrial areas.
